title: Howe evidence for motivation of reformers

content.prompt: Which of the following describes a piece of evidence used by Howe to support his overall argument about the motivations of religious reformers?

choices.label: They believed that they should focus their efforts only on the United States.
They sought to compete with other churches for religious converts.
They viewed reform mainly as a means of social control.
They desired to teach people personal autonomy.

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Identify the evidence used in a source to support an argument.
